lines.text:
[delivering books to Stroud's cell in D-Block]
How's the old Birdman?
Breaking even. The way I figure it, it's better than breaking out.
Thought you might've changed your mind.
It ain't gonna work, Bernie.
It'll work. It's *got* to.
"Got to" won't get you outta here.
It's all planned out.
Yeah. Sure it is. Now, if you could only walk on water.
We're taking over the boat.
I wish you luck.

[dayshift guards are arriving for work]
Hey-hey! Cece! How was the vacation?
Great. Took in Yosemite.
[they start walking up the hill to the main cellhouse]
I think this hill got steeper while I was gone.
Have you ever thought about living on the island?
No. Cathy won't consider it. It's too close to the cons, she says.

[in the breakfast line, the morning of the break]
You with us?
I got 'till noon.

[as Coy is getting ready to infiltrate the gun gallery]
We got enough time, Bernie?
If Crazy Sam can keep it up long enough, I'll make it.

[responding to Coy's promise of no blood being spilled during the break]
But the trouble is, you got Cretzer and Crazy Sam.
Dutch knows the ropes. He's made a couple of breaks before. And he ain't leaving without Sam.
Well, what about Thompson? I never know what he's thinking or what he's gonna do.
Who does? But he wants out bad, just like us. He ain't gonna give us any trouble.
Is the car all set?
connections. That's the trouble with you and Hubbard! Depression bums! You never made connections! How much time have we got?
The prison boat docks here at two. We've got forty minutes to make it.
Well we'd *better* make it. You know what I'm saying to you, Bernie? We'd just *better* make it.

[comes out of a cell, back to the desk by the messhall entrance, carrying the bag with his bar spreader]
I've got it.
This had better work!
It'll work.

[to Durando]
Keep an on Miller, kid.
[Durando runs off to the cell where Miller is being held]
Hey! What's the chances they'll have some hacks in that other gun gallery down there?
[indicates East Gun Gallery]
Not 'till after four o'clock. You and Cretzer go on down and keep an eye on the sallyport door for any screws coming through.
I'll take care of any screws! You just get Burch!
It's moving up towards noon, kid.
Bernie, I... I think I'm gonna pass on this. I'm only nineteen. I can get out someday.
Don't kid yourself. You're gonna end up just like The Birdman. We need you kid. We need you.
I just don't want any more blood; any more killing. Bernie, that guy I shot... I swear to God it was an accident, but he's dead just the same.
You got my promise. We go out clean.
Don't worry, Mister Lageson. It's gonna be ok.

[shaking his head sadly]
I never would've expected *you* to be in a fool thing like *this*, kid.
It was Corwin! He got me wet!
Stroud! We got it! We're going! Straight through the yard, down to the boat!
Now, how the hell do you do that?
Hostages. Four guards. You can still come, you know. What do you say?
I was dumb enough to get into this joint, Bernie. I ain't crazy enough to try and break out.
Well, we're going.
Where, Bernie? That's the problem. Where? Do you think it's worth it?
I tell you the God's truth. If I have to wake up *one* more morning in a cement cage, nine by six, not even knowing if it's daylight outside... You'd better believe it's worth it.
It's like I told you Bernie... Good luck.
Warden. We've got three officers down in the towers! Wounded!
Kick on the sirens!
We just got a report, sir! They've spotted Dutch Cretzer with a gun!
Cretzer? My god, he'd kill his own mother to get out of here!
They must've sprung him out of lock-up. God knows how many others.
How many guards do we have on the cellhouse floor? Right now?
Nine, plus Burch in the Gun Gallery. We haven't heard from *any* of them.
